meanings.definition: To untangle or free from snarls or knots.
meanings.sent1: She carefully unsnarled the yarn to continue knitting.
meanings.sent2: The fisherman unsnarled the fishing line caught on a rock.
meanings.sent3: The cat unsnarled itself from the curtains after a playful chase.
meanings.sent4: With patience and skill, she unsnarled the complicated situation.
meanings.sent5: He unsnarled the mess of wires with ease, like a magician untangling a knot.

meanings.sent1: The smooth silk ribbon was perfectly unsnarled.
meanings.sent2: Her hair looked unsnarled and shiny after using the new conditioner.
meanings.sent3: The unsnarled shoelaces stayed tied throughout the race.
meanings.sent4: The unsnarled rope glided smoothly through the pulley.
meanings.sent5: The unsnarled garden hose was a pleasure to use, no kinks or twists.
